sentences: Naised kandsid ohvreid ja palusid jumalatelt head saaki.
Ohvrite andmine usklike poolt on vanade traditsioonide osa.
context: The word 'ohvri' in Estonian is the genitive singular form of 'ohver' meaning sacrifice or victim. It indicates possession or relationship with a sacrifice/victim, often used in phrases like 'ohvri põletamine' (burning of sacrifices) or when referring to something belonging to or related to a sacrifice.
